User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: ChatZilla 0.9.86-rdmsoft [XULRunner 1.9.2.13/20101203074205]

ZNC (with the buffextras module) displays the join/part messages of users in whatever channels the user's IRC bouncer happens to be in. It displays them like this:

<nickname>!<ident>@host has joined #<channel>

cZ detects this as being an email, and treats it as such, which is highly inconvenient when scrolling through a log of a channel

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Attach to a ZNC server with the buffextras module loaded and a buffer where someone has joined, parted, etc. (or do something that would show users in the aforementioned format)
2. Look at the way cZ treats the hostmask


Actual Results:  
The hostmask is treated as an email address.

Expected Results:  
The hostmask shouldn't be treated as an email address

Perhaps have it detect the ! between the nickname and ident?
